title.raw: 《孝文本紀》 Annals of the Xiaowen Emperor

sentences.zh: 孝文皇帝，高祖中子也。

translations.literal: Emperor Xiaowen was Gaozu's middle son.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiaowen was Gaozu's middle son.

sentences.zh: 高祖十一年春，已破陳豨軍，定代地，立為代王，都中都。

translations.literal: In the spring of Gaozu's eleventh year, after defeating Chen Xi's army and pacifying the Dai region, he was established as King of Dai with his capital at Zhongdu.
translations.idiomatic: in the spring of Gaozu's eleventh year, after defeating Chen Xi's army and pacifying the Dai region, he was established as King of Dai with his capital at Zhongdu.

sentences.zh: 太后薄氏子。

translations.literal: He was the son of Empress Dowager Bo.
translations.idiomatic: he was the son of Empress Dowager Bo.

sentences.zh: 即位十七年，高后八年七月，高后崩。

translations.literal: He ascended the throne in the seventeenth year of his reign. In the seventh month of Empress Gao's eighth year, Empress Gao passed away.
translations.idiomatic: he ascended the throne in the seventeenth year of his reign. in the seventh month of Empress Gao's eighth year, Empress Gao passed away.

sentences.zh: 九月，諸呂呂產等欲為亂，以危劉氏，大臣共誅之，謀召立代王，事在呂后語中。

translations.literal: In the ninth month, the Lü clansmen led by Lü Chan plotted rebellion to endanger the Liu clan. The ministers executed them together and plotted to summon and establish the King of Dai. This matter is detailed in the Lü Empress Dowager's biography.
translations.idiomatic: in the ninth month, the Lü clansmen led by Lü Chan plotted rebellion to endanger the Liu clan. the ministers executed them together and plotted to summon and establish the King of Dai. this matter is detailed in the Lü Empress Dowager's biography.

translations.literal: Emperor Xiaowen was Gaozu's middle son. In the spring of Gaozu's eleventh year, after defeating Chen Xi's army and pacifying the Dai region, he was established as King of Dai with his capital at Zhongdu. He was the son of Empress Dowager Bo. He ascended the throne in the seventeenth year of his reign. In the seventh month of Empress Gao's eighth year, Empress Gao passed away. In the ninth month, the Lü clansmen led by Lü Chan plotted rebellion to endanger the Liu clan. The ministers executed them together and plotted to summon and establish the King of Dai. This matter is detailed in the Lü Empress Dowager's biography.

sentences.zh: 丞相陳平、太尉周勃等使人迎代王。

translations.literal: Chancellor Chen Ping, Grand Marshal Zhou Bo, and others sent people to welcome the King of Dai.
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Chen Ping, Grand Marshal Zhou Bo, and others sent people to welcome the King of Dai.

sentences.zh: 代王問左右郎中令張武等。

translations.literal: The King of Dai consulted with his attendants including Chamberlain for Attendants Zhang Wu.
translations.idiomatic: the King of Dai consulted with his attendants including Chamberlain for Attendants Zhang Wu.

translations.literal: Zhang Wu etc. discussed said: 'Han ministers all former Gao Di time great generals, practiced in arms, many stratagems and deceits, this their intentions not stop here also, especially feared Gao Di, Lu Empress Dowager awe only.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Wu and the others discussed: 'The Han ministers are all great generals from the time of Emperor Gao. They are experienced in warfare and full of stratagems. Their intentions go beyond this - they only fear the awe-inspiring presence of Emperor Gao and Empress Dowager Lü.'

sentences.zh: 今已誅諸呂，新啑血京師，此以迎大王為名，實不可信。

translations.literal: Now that the Lü clansmen have been executed and fresh blood stains the capital, their claim to welcome Your Majesty is just a pretense and cannot be trusted.
translations.idiomatic: Now that the Lü clansmen have been executed and fresh blood stains the capital, their claim to welcome your Majesty is just a pretense and cannot be trusted.

translations.idiomatic: We urge Your Majesty to feign illness and not go, so we can observe how the situation develops.'

translations.literal: Commandant Song Chang advanced said: 'The various ministers' discussions all wrong also.
translations.idiomatic: Commandant Song Chang stepped forward and said: 'All the ministers' discussions are wrong.

sentences.zh: 夫秦失其政，諸侯豪桀并起，人人自以為得之者以萬數，然卒踐天子之位者，劉氏也，天下絕望，一矣。

translations.literal: When Qin lost its mandate, feudal lords and outstanding men rose up together. Tens of thousands considered themselves worthy of the throne, yet in the end it was the Liu clan who ascended the imperial position. The realm had lost all hope - that was the first reason.
translations.idiomatic: when Qin lost its mandate, feudal lords and outstanding men rose up together. Tens of thousands considered themselves worthy of the throne, yet in the end it was the Liu clan who ascended the imperial position. the realm had lost all hope - that was the first reason.

sentences.zh: 高帝封王子弟，地犬牙相制，此所謂盤石之宗也，天下服其彊，二矣。

translations.literal: Emperor Gao enfeoffed his sons and brothers with interlocking territories that controlled each other like interlocking dog teeth. This was what is called an unshakeable clan foundation. The realm submitted to its power - that was the second reason.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gao enfeoffed his sons and brothers with interlocking territories that controlled each other like interlocking dog teeth. this was what is called an unshakeable clan foundation. the realm submitted to its power - that was the second reason.

sentences.zh: 漢興，除秦苛政，約法令，施德惠，人人自安，難動搖，三矣。

translations.literal: When the Han arose, they eliminated Qin's harsh rule, simplified the laws and commands, and bestowed virtue and favor. Everyone lived in peace and was difficult to unsettle - that was the third reason.
translations.idiomatic: when the Han arose, they eliminated Qin's harsh rule, simplified the laws and commands, and bestowed virtue and favor. Everyone lived in peace and was difficult to unsettle - that was the third reason.

sentences.zh: 夫以呂太后之嚴，立諸呂為三王，擅權專制，然而太尉以一節入北軍，一呼士皆左袒，為劉氏，叛諸呂，卒以滅之。

translations.literal: Despite Empress Dowager Lü's strict rule and her establishment of three Lü kings who monopolized power, the Grand Marshal entered the Northern Army with just one tally. With one shout, all the soldiers bared their left arms for the Liu clan, rebelled against the Lü clan, and finally destroyed them.

With one shout, all the soldiers bared their left arms for the Liu clan, rebelled against the Lü clan, and finally destroyed them.

sentences.zh: 此乃天授，非人力也。

translations.literal: This was Heaven's gift, not achieved through human effort.
translations.idiomatic: this was heaven's gift, not achieved through human effort.

translations.idiomatic: Now even if the ministers wanted to rebel, the common people would not follow them. How could their faction remain united?

sentences.zh: 方今內有朱虛、東牟之親，外畏吳、楚、淮南、瑯邪、齊、代之彊。

translations.literal: At present, internally we have the support of relatives in Zhuxu and Dongmou, externally we fear the strength of Wu, Chu, Huainan, Langye, Qi, and Dai.
translations.idiomatic: At present, internally we have the support of relatives in Zhuxu and Dongmou, externally we fear the strength of Wu, Chu, Huainan, Langye, Qi, and Dai.

sentences.zh: 方今高帝子獨淮南王與大王，大王又長，賢聖仁孝，聞於天下，故大臣因天下之心而欲迎立大王，大王勿疑也。」

translations.literal: Present time Gao Di sons only Huainan King and great king, great king moreover elder, worthy sage benevolent filial, heard throughout realm, therefore ministers follow realm heart and desire welcome establish great king, great king do not doubt also.'
translations.idiomatic: Among Emperor Gao's surviving sons, only the King of Huainan and Your Majesty remain. Your Majesty is also the elder, and your worthiness, wisdom, benevolence, and filial piety are renowned throughout the realm. Therefore, the ministers, following the will of the people, wish to welcome and establish Your Majesty. Your Majesty should have no doubts.'

sentences.zh: 代王報太后計之，猶與未定。

translations.literal: The King of Dai reported to Empress Dowager Bo and consulted her about it, but they were still undecided.
translations.idiomatic: the King of Dai reported to Empress Dowager Bo and consulted her about it, but they were still undecided.

translations.literal: They divined with a turtle shell and obtained the hexagram 'Great Horizontal.'
translations.idiomatic: they divined with a turtle shell and obtained the hexagram 'Great Horizontal.'

translations.literal: Divination said: 'Great horizontal geng geng, I become Heaven King, Xia Qi with light.'
translations.idiomatic: The divination said: 'Great horizontal, geng geng - I shall become the Heavenly King, like Xia Qi shining with light.'

translations.literal: Dai King said: 'I already solidly am king already, again what king?'
translations.idiomatic: The King of Dai said: 'I am already a king. What other king could this mean?'

translations.literal: Diviner said: 'So-called Heaven King namely Son of Heaven.'
translations.idiomatic: The diviner said: 'The so-called Heavenly King refers to the Son of Heaven.'

sentences.zh: 於是代王乃遣太后弟薄昭往見絳侯，絳侯等具為昭言所以迎立王意。

translations.literal: Thereupon the King of Dai dispatched Empress Dowager Bo's younger brother Bo Zhao to see the Marquis of Jiang. The Marquis of Jiang and others fully explained to Bo Zhao the reasons for welcoming and establishing the king.
translations.idiomatic: thereupon the King of Dai dispatched Empress Dowager Bo's younger brother Bo Zhao to see the Marquis of Jiang. the Marquis of Jiang and others fully explained to Bo Zhao the reasons for welcoming and establishing the king.

translations.literal: Bo Zhao returned reported said: 'Trustworthy already, no can doubt ones.'
translations.idiomatic: Bo Zhao returned and reported: 'It's trustworthy. There should be no doubts.'

sentences.zh: 代王乃笑謂宋昌曰：「果如公言。」

translations.literal: Dai King then laughed told Song Chang said: 'Indeed like gentleman words.'
translations.idiomatic: The King of Dai then laughed and told Song Chang: 'Indeed, just as you said.'

sentences.zh: 乃命宋昌參乘，張武等六人乘傳詣長安。

translations.literal: Then ordered Song Chang ride as attendant, Zhang Wu etc. six people ride relay carriages go to Chang'an.
translations.idiomatic: He then ordered Song Chang to ride as his chariot attendant, and Zhang Wu and five others to ride relay carriages to Chang'an.

translations.literal: Reached Gaoling rested stopped, and made Song Chang first gallop to Chang'an observe changes.
translations.idiomatic: They reached Gaoling and rested there, while sending Song Chang ahead to gallop to Chang'an and observe the situation.

translations.literal: Chancellor Chen Ping, Grand Marshal Zhou Bo, and others sent people to welcome the King of Dai. The King of Dai consulted with his attendants including Chamberlain for Attendants Zhang Wu. Zhang Wu and the others discussed: 'The Han ministers are all great generals from the time of Emperor Gao. They are experienced in warfare and full of stratagems. Their intentions go beyond this - they only fear the awe-inspiring presence of Emperor Gao and Empress Dowager Lü.' Now that the Lü clansmen have been executed and fresh blood stains the capital, their claim to welcome Your Majesty is just a pretense and cannot be trusted. We urge Your Majesty to feign illness and not go, so we can observe how the situation develops.' Commandant Song Chang stepped forward and said: 'All the ministers' discussions are wrong. When Qin lost its mandate, feudal lords and outstanding men rose up together. Tens of thousands considered themselves worthy of the throne, yet in the end it was the Liu clan who ascended the imperial position. The realm had lost all hope - that was the first reason. Emperor Gao enfeoffed his sons and brothers with interlocking territories that controlled each other like interlocking dog teeth. This was what is called an unshakeable clan foundation. The realm submitted to its power - that was the second reason. When the Han arose, they eliminated Qin's harsh rule, simplified the laws and commands, and bestowed virtue and favor. Everyone lived in peace and was difficult to unsettle - that was the third reason. Despite Empress Dowager Lü's strict rule and her establishment of three Lü kings who monopolized power, the Grand Marshal entered the Northern Army with just one tally. With one shout, all the soldiers bared their left arms for the Liu clan, rebelled against the Lü clan, and finally destroyed them. This was Heaven's gift, not achieved through human effort. Now even if the ministers wanted to rebel, the common people would not follow them. How could their faction remain united? At present, internally we have the support of relatives in Zhuxu and Dongmou, externally we fear the strength of Wu, Chu, Huainan, Langye, Qi, and Dai. Among Emperor Gao's surviving sons, only the King of Huainan and Your Majesty remain. Your Majesty is also the elder, and your worthiness, wisdom, benevolence, and filial piety are renowned throughout the realm. Therefore, the ministers, following the will of the people, wish to welcome and establish Your Majesty. Your Majesty should have no doubts.' The King of Dai reported to Empress Dowager Bo and consulted her about it, but they were still undecided. They divined with a turtle shell and obtained the hexagram 'Great Horizontal.' The divination said: 'Great horizontal, geng geng - I shall become the Heavenly King, like Xia Qi shining with light.' The King of Dai said: 'I am already a king. What other king could this mean?' The diviner said: 'The so-called Heavenly King refers to the Son of Heaven.' Thereupon the King of Dai dispatched Empress Dowager Bo's younger brother Bo Zhao to see the Marquis of Jiang. The Marquis of Jiang and others fully explained to Bo Zhao the reasons for welcoming and establishing the king. Bo Zhao returned and reported: 'It's trustworthy. There should be no doubts.' The King of Dai then laughed and told Song Chang: 'Indeed, just as you said.' He then ordered Song Chang to ride as his chariot attendant, and Zhang Wu and five others to ride relay carriages to Chang'an. They reached Gaoling and rested there, while sending Song Chang ahead to gallop to Chang'an and observe the situation.

translations.idiomatic: the King of Dai galloped to the wei Bridge, where the ministers bowed in audience and addressed him as minister.

translations.idiomatic: the King of Dai descended from his chariot and bowed.

translations.literal: Grand Marshal Bo advanced said: 'Wish request private words.'
translations.idiomatic: Grand Marshal Bo stepped forward and said: 'I wish to speak with you privately.'

translations.idiomatic: Song Chang said: 'If it's a public matter, speak it openly.

translations.idiomatic: the Grand Marshal then knelt and presented the imperial seal and tally.

translations.idiomatic: the ministers followed and arrived.

translations.idiomatic: The King of Dai said: 'Serving at Emperor Gao's ancestral temple is a grave matter.

translations.idiomatic: All the ministers prostrated themselves and firmly requested.

translations.literal: The King of Dai declined three times while facing west, and declined twice while facing south.
translations.idiomatic: the King of Dai declined three times while facing west, and declined twice while facing south.

translations.idiomatic: we ministers, for the sake of the ancestral temple and the state, dare not be negligent.
